description: Best browser for any device
hace lo que debe

I couldnt watch crunchyroll on Firefox or Chromium because of DRM, so i downloaded Edge. It worked for 5min. before crashing my PC. Wenn i rebooted, Firefox was removed from my KDE Plasma panel and replaced by Edge. Edge also made itself my default browser. However i did not click the opttion in Edge to make it my default broeser. Honestly I peersonally have never experienced Microsofts terrible practices effect me, despite using Windows in the past, quite like that. What the hell. 

FYI btw i use Arch ;) with KDE Plasma 6
summary: crashed my PC and made itself default browser

description: Microsoft Edge is an amazing browser for what it can offer, however remember that it's Microsoft controlling it. If I were to pick the best browser personally, I would go with Brave as it also has many of the key features Edge has (AI and vertical tabs). If you're using Google Chrome then this is a huge step up in many ways. This is a great default browser but since this is Linux we're talking about, there's almost no point of using Microsoft edge aside from consistency with the other Microsoft stuff. There's no judgement that should be done what someone uses on their rightfully-owned system and if you love what Microsoft offers for Edge then by all means use it.
By far the best web browser in any platform, even more so for Linux.
works well and trust them more than Google I guess
The Microsoft Edge Browser with Xbox Game streaming works incredibly well. I was surprised with how well XCloud does on my steak deck. Thank you Microsoft!
works great as steam app in order to use xbox cloud games
It takes a bit to get it installed, but once you do it provides the same great browsing experience on ClearLinux as it does in Windows 11.
In order use the GnOME extensions website with Edge, you mst use the .deb or .rpm package version. Edge is otherwise, a great browser. It's my default.
summary: Flatpak version doesn't play well with GNOME

description: fyfsgtftrfedfytfsts56rtd

It is great to see Edge in the store but sadly the flatpak version runs slow compared to the deb version, plus I have add a few problems with edge extensions not working such as Plasma Integration. All extensions work on the deb version.
I always use Read Aloud for my pdf books on Windows 10, thus I can enjoy audiobook when I'm chilling.....yeah, on Linux. Hope Microsoft Engineers fix this.
firefox is amazingly buggy but thankfully I decidedto try edge.Good job MS!

The browser is great, it's fast, has all the privacy extensions firefox has, like ublock, HTTPS everywhere and noscript. It can do gamepass and it's pretty lightweight using about 650mb of RAM running a youtube video.

The only issue I have is the scrolling speed is slower compare to Firefox and even Edge on Windows. I have enabled smooth scrolling and turned off and on some other scrolling options but it didn't help and the scrolling is slower than I'd like it to be.

But I'll still keep it 5 stars because some people may like the scrolling and I can see this being fixed soon. If not, Ill adjust to 4 stars.
Using Fedora 36 Gnome
summary: I know it's Microsoft, but its good!

But hey, at least you don't have to use IE in wine any more lol, and *hopefully* you can uninstall it

Been using this browser on my Steam Deck for browsing & cloud gaming. Since mid January it now crashes within minutes of opening. Does not work at all.
With a browser this full of upsells, what's the point of an adblocker?
I'll remain on Firefox for most of my day, but Edge helps me stay in touch within the MS world on Linux... even in Wayland.

For me it's the best browser generally. Perfect compatibility with every system I use: Linux, Windows, and Android. Cross-saving plugins, settings, tabs (aka: collections), etc.

I used it for new Bing, and it works very well!

It seems that microsoft did us a favour for allowing us to use Edge on Linux. 
The browswer kinda works but "read aloud" feature was removed specifically for Linux users since after version 98. So it's possible to install but features might suddenly get missing depending on MS mood
After you run the microsoft edge, it start to force close after a few seconds. Not recommended. Please author fix this problem please.

Microsoft is bad. I get it. But. If you want to embrace the dark side, Edge is a good way to do it. It's a good browser. It's fast, has extensions, AI, and connects you to Onedrive and Office if you need to use such things. I prefer it over Chrome and Firefox.
I hate MS, but fact that this is faster than chromium, browser that this based on really got me. 5 stars for quality - 1 star for MS.

I enjoy Edge under Win/macOS already for quite some time. Fast engine, high compatibility, hibernating tabs, and great use if you have some personal credentials in the Microsoft ecosystem. For me it's bookmark syncing between my other platforms and some functionality which is tied to my Xbox Series console. So, if you don't like things from Microsoft, skip Edge. If you don't mind this mix of FOSS and somewhat propietary browser pack, give it a try.
summary: Fast, reliable, and great for a foot in MS ecosystem

description: Favorites Passwords - Memory
Much faster than chrome
What the title says.

The only reason I used this browser is so that I could watch 60fps 1440p videos, which isn't possible on Firefox. Everything else about this wrapper of Edge is atrocious, since it blocks the ability to use hardware acceleration, making loads of websites slow and borderline unusable.
The flatpak version has slow graphical performance on the Flatpak version than the native version. For example, Youtube videos will be slightly laggy on 4K, and 3D graphic apps will be much slower.

How come on Beta we get access to "Microsoft Edge rounded corners" without the flag even existing (it's simply Project Kodiak) but when enabled in stable there is no new option in settings nor does it activate. This is the only visual update I want in the upcoming visual overhaul but you didn't carry it over to stable in v116??? WHY...

Opening full screen without option to escape from, default sending all data it can get to microsoft, obligation to create a account at microsoft to be able to continue the setup, and more of these dark patterns where the Chrome copycats are known for. Do not use this cr-a-p application, use Vivaldi or Chromium.
summary: It intrudes your system like a virus

description: Stable, but some features like DNS are disabled because it thinks it's managed by an organization.
Dispete this a Microsoft Brower, I had many problems with Firefox, Brave and now I am testing the the Microsoft Edge, and so far, I am loving it.
Edge DOES NOT require a Mircrosoft account to use it, its only used if you want to sync. you can also select not to send data to Microsoft

Faster than Firefox. Native vertical tabs. Full Chrome/Chromium extension ecosystem. Profile syncing. I thought I'd hate it, but here I am 18 months later using it on all of my computers and my phone.
Cant even turn off taking screenshot of my history in the settings menu
Edge for Linux does not have some of the good functions from the Windows version. For example Read Aloud.
summary: Not feature complete compared to Windows

description: Feels like i have the full windows experience on steam deck. Haven't run into any issues.

Nach dem veröffentlichen von Bing AI habe ich den Browser tatsächlich genutzt. Ich war echt positiv überrascht. Besonders die Tap Organisation, die Seitenleiste und den Copilot möchte ich nicht wider hergeben. Leider ist das Ding voll mit Werbung für ms Dienste und Bloatware. Ich musste den Browser etwa 20 Minuten aufräumen, damit ich ihn anschliessend wirklich benutzen wollte. Ich nutze Linux und da ist es auch hier und da mal schön ein paar Bugs aus dem hause Microsoft zu geniessen. Das weckt in mir nostalgische Erinnerungen an Windows. Ehrlich gesagt ist dies auch nur mein Haupt Browser, weil sich meine Linux nutzenden Kollegen davon Provoziert fühlen.
great chromium based browser
More tracking than features.

funktioniert tadellos

The Flatpak itself has okay restricted permissions, it still can read lots of Files and with internet access its not a safe app. It cant be made privacy friendly at all, and by default it will track everything you do.

The Flatpak itself is actually pretty good, but this means it has access to many APIs and system components.

Use it only with Internet and more permissions restricted, maybe as a PDF editor or so.

Halte mit Edge meine sensiblen Daten, mein Microsoft 365 und den dazugehörigen Cloudspeicher Synchron, ohne Windoof zu brauchen. Find ich super! Zum bearbeiten von Websiten, ist es von Vorteil mit der dedizierten Grafik zu starten: Bis jetzt keine Probleme.
Ihr könnt alle schimpfen, wie ihr wollt - ich finde es richtig gut, dass es Edge für Linux gibt. Dies ist einer meiner wichtigsten Punkte, um auf Linux zu wechseln.

... that I have been missing out entirely on this browser wars as I had always sticked with Mozilla Firefox - even during dire times. 

So, after its inception (how many years again?), I tried out Edge from Microsoft and there so many features I did not know I wanted. That exactly made a huge difference. 

Another thing I want to highlight here is that fact to effortlessly change between profiles, especially true if you work in a business environment. Next to that, some web application (for business) just work better with Chrome-based browsers.

Other than that, I really like the feature collections which is sort of like a bookmark collection but more visually grouped. Moreover, I appreciate setting up different activity profiles within the browser and link them with a profile (personal/business).

En Windows es mi navegador predeterminado, pero en linux especificamente en Fedora con Gnome tiene el siguiente problema, al validar la identidad en cualquier página que lo requiera ya sea a través de códigos captcha o códigos al sms o token de autenticación (osea, cualquier medio de verificación) no logra pasar la verificación y muestra "página inexistente". No sé si este problema esté generalizado o si Microsoft se encargará de resolverlo ahora que aman a Linux, quién sabrá.
De todos los navegadores que he probado, me gusta es intitivo y amo la forma en la que maneja las aplicaciones en la barra lateral.

Es un navegador con un aspecto elegante y veloz. No puedo usar la extensión de Gnome Shell, pero debe ser que me falta hacer algun ajuste por ser un Flatpak. La aceleración de video por hardware parece funcionar. Lo estoy usando con Wayland.
summary: Exelente. Funciona bien en Arch Linux

Instalacion limpia de Fedora 37/38
El mejor navegador !
Microsoft ha hecho un gran trabajo con su navegador, funciona muy bien y sobre todo sincronizado entre los distintos dispositivos donde lo uso

La función de chat de Bing integrada en Edge es muy útil para buscar información y resolver dudas rápidamente.

En cuanto a su ligereza, Edge es un navegador muy rápido y eficiente. Está diseñado para consumir pocos recursos del sistema, lo que lo hace ideal para equipos con especificaciones modestas. Además, cuenta con una interfaz limpia y minimalista que lo hace muy fácil de usar.
summary: Ha mejorado mucho siendo más Ligero y con IA
